children.name: according
children.sourceText: And I will go according to thy command and pay the last tribute of wine to the Lamanites, and they will be drunken; and we will pass through the secret pass on the left of their camp when they are drunken and asleep.

children.name: a
children.sourceText: And now let us pacify the king, and we fulfil the oath which we have made unto him; for it is better that we should be in bondage than that we should lose our lives; therefore, let us put a stop to the shedding of so much blood.

children.name: all
children.sourceText: For are not the words of Abinadi fulfilled, which he prophesied against us, and all this because we would not hearken unto the words of the Lord, and turn from our iniquities?

children.name: among
children.sourceText: The Lamanites, or the guards of the Lamanites, by night are drunken; therefore let us send a proclamation among all this people that they gather together their flocks and herds, that they may drive them into the wilderness by night.

children.name: an
children.sourceText: And now O king, if thou hast not found me to be an unprofitable servant, or if thou hast hitherto listened to my words in any degree, and they have been of service to thee, even so I desire that thou wouldst listen to my words at this time, and I will be thy servant and deliver this people out of bondage.

children.name: and
children.sourceText: I pray thee forbear, and do not search this people, and lay not this thing to their charge.

children.name: any
children.sourceText: And now O king, if thou hast not found me to be an unprofitable servant, or if thou hast hitherto listened to my words in any degree, and they have been of service to thee, even so I desire that thou wouldst listen to my words at this time, and I will be thy servant and deliver this people out of bondage.

children.name: around
children.sourceText: Thus we will depart with our women and our children, our flocks, and our herds into the wilderness; and we will travel around the land of Shilom.

children.name: at
children.sourceText: And now O king, if thou hast not found me to be an unprofitable servant, or if thou hast hitherto listened to my words in any degree, and they have been of service to thee, even so I desire that thou wouldst listen to my words at this time, and I will be thy servant and deliver this people out of bondage.

children.name: because
children.sourceText: For are not the words of Abinadi fulfilled, which he prophesied against us, and all this because we would not hearken unto the words of the Lord, and turn from our iniquities?

children.name: but
children.sourceText: And now, behold, and tell the king of these things, that he may tell his people that they may be pacified towards us; for behold they are already preparing to come against us; and behold also there are but few of us.

children.name: by
children.sourceText: The Lamanites, or the guards of the Lamanites, by night are drunken; therefore let us send a proclamation among all this people that they gather together their flocks and herds, that they may drive them into the wilderness by night.

children.name: except
children.sourceText: And behold, they come with their numerous hosts; and except the king doth pacify them towards us we must perish.

children.name: few
children.sourceText: And now, behold, and tell the king of these things, that he may tell his people that they may be pacified towards us; for behold they are already preparing to come against us; and behold also there are but few of us.

children.name: for
children.sourceText: For do ye not remember the priests of thy father, whom this people sought to destroy?

children.name: from
children.sourceText: For are not the words of Abinadi fulfilled, which he prophesied against us, and all this because we would not hearken unto the words of the Lord, and turn from our iniquities?

children.name: I

children.sourceText: And now O king, if thou hast not found me to be an unprofitable servant, or if thou hast hitherto listened to my words in any degree, and they have been of service to thee, even so I desire that thou wouldst listen to my words at this time, and I will be thy servant and deliver this people out of bondage.

children.name: in
children.sourceText: And are they not in the wilderness?

children.name: into
children.sourceText: The Lamanites, or the guards of the Lamanites, by night are drunken; therefore let us send a proclamation among all this people that they gather together their flocks and herds, that they may drive them into the wilderness by night.

children.name: it
children.sourceText: And now let us pacify the king, and we fulfil the oath which we have made unto him; for it is better that we should be in bondage than that we should lose our lives; therefore, let us put a stop to the shedding of so much blood.

children.name: many
children.sourceText: Now O king, thou hast hitherto hearkened unto my words many times when we have been contending with our brethren, the Lamanites.

children.name: may
children.sourceText: And now, behold, and tell the king of these things, that he may tell his people that they may be pacified towards us; for behold they are already preparing to come against us; and behold also there are but few of us.

children.name: my

children.name: o
children.sourceText: Now O king, thou hast hitherto hearkened unto my words many times when we have been contending with our brethren, the Lamanites.

children.name: of
children.sourceText: For do ye not remember the priests of thy father, whom this people sought to destroy?

children.name: on
children.sourceText: Behold the back pass, through the back wall, on the back side of the city.

children.name: or
children.sourceText: And now O king, if thou hast not found me to be an unprofitable servant, or if thou hast hitherto listened to my words in any degree, and they have been of service to thee, even so I desire that thou wouldst listen to my words at this time, and I will be thy servant and deliver this people out of bondage.

children.sourceText: Thus we will depart with our women and our children, our flocks, and our herds into the wilderness; and we will travel around the land of Shilom.

children.name: which
children.sourceText: For are not the words of Abinadi fulfilled, which he prophesied against us, and all this because we would not hearken unto the words of the Lord, and turn from our iniquities?

children.name: who
children.sourceText: And are not they the ones who have stolen the daughters of the Lamanites?

children.name: whom
children.sourceText: For do ye not remember the priests of thy father, whom this people sought to destroy?

children.name: will
children.sourceText: And now O king, if thou hast not found me to be an unprofitable servant, or if thou hast hitherto listened to my words in any degree, and they have been of service to thee, even so I desire that thou wouldst listen to my words at this time, and I will be thy servant and deliver this people out of bondage.

children.name: ye
